intro: Rhagadiolus scaber, commonly known as the rough rhagadiolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Rhagadiolus scaber is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
